TopicTitle: [1.12.X] Tantares - Stockalike Soyuz and MIR [16.1][28.05.2024][{Proton Revamp]

Articles.Content:
Perhaps someone can help me?

Is not possible to use more than one MODEL_MULTI_PARTICLE in an engine?

I ask because the main effect will not show.

Here is my setup.

See only vernierTransform display effect.

EFFECTS
{
  running_closed
  {
    AUDIO
    {
      channel = Ship
      clip = sound_rocket_hard
      volume = 0.0 0.0
      volume = 3.0 3.0
      pitch = 0.0 0.2
      pitch = 1.0 1.0
      loop = true
    }
    MODEL_MULTI_PARTICLE
    {
      modelName = Squad/FX/shockExhaust_blue
      transformName = thrustTransform
      emission = 0.0 0.0
      emission = 0.05 0.0
      emission = 0.075 0.25
      emission = 1.0 1.25
      speed = 0.0 0.5
      speed = 1.0 1.2
    }
    MODEL_MULTI_PARTICLE
    {
      modelName = Squad/FX/LES_Thruster
      transformName = vernierTransform
      emission = 0.0 0.0
      emission = 0.05 0.0
      emission = 0.075 0.25
      emission = 1.0 1.25
      speed = 0.0 0.5
      speed = 1.0 1.2
    }
  }
  engage
  {
    AUDIO
    {
      channel = Ship
      clip = sound_vent_soft
      volume = 1.0
      pitch = 2.0
      loop = false
    }
  }
  flameout
  {
    PREFAB_PARTICLE
    {
      prefabName = fx_exhaustSparks_flameout_2
      transformName = thrustTransform
      oneShot = true
    }
    AUDIO
    {
      channel = Ship
      clip = sound_explosion_low
      volume = 1.0
      pitch = 2.0
      loop = false
    }
  }
}

Sorry my usual grammar checking is not working

Is not possible to use more than one MODEL_MULTI_PARTICLE in an engine?

I think you should try to add it as another effect to separate it from the vernier's. I'm no expert of course but perhaps it could work.

I think you should try to add it as another effect to separate it from the vernier's. I'm no expert of course but perhaps it could work.

I LOVE this rocket! Any hints on release date and stats?

The 2-3 interstage isn't a truss, the second stage has retrorockets, and the 3rd one ullages (IIRC) using it's verniers.

Proton doesn't have ullage motors; instead, second and third stages' engines are fired seconds before stage separation, and separation itself happens when 2nd (3rd) stage engine thrust is equal of that of 1st (2nd). But they do have retrorockets.

No, the 3rd stage does not use hot-staging. I don't know where you've got that idea (you can't have hot staging with a solid interstage). The second stage, yes, but the 3rd on first fires it's verniers (which are pressure-fed at that point), then the main engine.

Can't wait for your Proton, Beale. Also, I made a Salyut-7 thing with your parts. http://i.imgur.com/GU3pcf9.png

I kid, that's actually a really nice station

Hopefully the next update will give it some functionality.

Edit: Erm, what version of Tantares are you using, I notice the Soyuz has 3 panels instead it should have 4?

There was a bug in some Mac users where the panels would revert to 3 rather than 4.

O das good.

I LOVE this rocket! Any hints on release date and stats?

A full stats breakdown can be found a few pages ago, courtesy of Niemand303.

A rough benchmark is around 25tons to 500km orbit.

The two stage version can get around 10tons to the same orbit.

The textures are pretty conservative, so low memory usage.

All are 512x512 (128x128 for emissives)

Release date - 2-3 days
